STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 10, 2020
Rachel Sykes
Lutheran Adoption Service
1545 Keystone
Lansing, MI 48911
RE: License #: CB330361250
Lutheran Adoption Service
1545 Keystone
Lansing, MI 48911
Dear Ms. Sykes:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
12/10/20. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Settlement Agreement (MSA)
requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the MSA and your contract. As indicated above substantial compliance has been
established therefore, your license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Rorie Dodge-Garnaat, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
235 Grand, Ste 1305
P.O. Box 30650
Lansing, MI 48909
(517) 899-6024

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency is in the process of completing two Corrective Action Plans to address
violations cited during two Special Investigations.
Special Investigation 2021C0103001 was initiated when it was reported that the
agency failed to re-apply for adoption subsidy for an adoptive family. The agency
was found in violation of AAM 200 Changes in family or child’s circumstances. A
CAP is due on 12/24/20.
Special Investigation 2021C0103003 was initiated when it was reported that an
adoption worker disclosed personal information to a youth and wraparound team.
The agency was found in violation of R 400.12206 Staff qualifications. A CAP is due
on 12/24/20.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
12/10/20
